newsitem.title: JAPAN: Moody's says may raise Suruga Bank deposit rating.
newsitem.headline: Moody's says may raise Suruga Bank deposit rating.

text.p: Moody's Investors Service said on Wednesday that it had placed Suruga Bank Ltd's long-term deposit rating under review for possible upgrade.
Moody's said in a statement that its current rating for Suruga Bank's long-term deposits was Baa1.
The rating agency also placed the bank's Prime-2 short-term deposit rating and its D bank financial strength rating under review.

Moody's said that Suruga, based in Shizuoka Prefecture in central Japan, has demonstrated comparatively strong profitability because of it strategic emphasis on the retail and middle-market segments, primarily housing loans.
The review will assess whether the bank will be able to sustain its profitability against increasing competition in the bank's primary operating region, Moody's said.
